title: Stuck Paying Student Debt Instead of Starting a Family
sub_head: Saddling the young with debt from student loans has consequences.
body:
“Their debt has consumed so much of their earnings,” writes Josh Mitchell in “The Debt Trap,” reviewed by Daniel Akst (Bookshelf, Aug. 2): High debt, high incomes—let’s all run in place! The focus should be on wealth building, not incomes and the rat race. Worse, debt-ridden young people cannot afford children. The years we expect them to pay their student loans are the very years they would otherwise be supporting families. Does our nation benefit when these obligations compete at the same time?
Teresa R. Manning
National Association of Scholars
New York
